content: hooded baby sweater with back zipper adapted by sarah punderson the hood fits snuggly around the face and the zipper makes it very easy to get the sweater off and on i have adapted the original pattern to eliminate the crocheted edge around the back opening sizes newborn 5-10lbs 6 months 11-18lbs 12 months 19-24lbs 18 months 24lbs 2 years the pattern is written and yarn requirements are listed in the smallest size with changes for larger sizes in parenthesis yarn worsted weight yarn 290 300 330 380 400 yds all samples are knitted with plymouth encore needles & notions us 5/3 75mm & us 8/5mm circulars may be easier to use for some parts of the sweater even though it is not done in the round 4 ring markers 1 split ring marker neckline zipper 18 18 22 22 22 inch sewing thread & needle gauge 18 stitches = 4in/10cm 24 row = 4in/10cm in st st directions sweater starts with hood stitches are picked up at neck edge and the sweater is knitted from clockwise from left upper corner newborn 6 months 12 months 18 months top to bottom the zipper is sewn into the back opening hood  with larger needles co 58 58 62 70 74 sts  row 1&3 *k2 p2 * repeat between ** to last 2 sts k2 odd row are rs row tip hang a split ring marker to mark rs  row 2 & 4 *p2 k2 * repeat between ** to last 2 sts p2  row 5 & 7 k6 cont in rib pattern to last 6 sts k6  row 6 p6 cont in rib pattern to last 6 sts p6  row 8 & 10 k8 cont in rib pattern to last 8 sts k8  row 9 p8 cont in rib pattern to last 8 sts p8  row 11 & 13 k10 cont in rib pattern to last 10sts k10  row 12 p10 cont in rib pattern to last 10 sts p10  continue in this manner increasing the number of stitches knit or purled at each end of the row by 2 every 4th row until 2 stitches are left in the center knit 1 row bind off body fold hood in half placing wrong sides together with bound off edge kept for zipper opening in the back starting at the bottom of bound off edge with smaller needles pick up and knit 27 29 31 34 36 sts co 5 5 5 7 7 sts for chin pick up and knit 27 29 31 34 36 sts on other side 59 63 67 75 79 sts you will pick up every other stitch plus a few extras  row 1 3 5 & 7 ws * p1 k1 * repeat between ** to last st p1  row 2 4 & 6 *k1 p1 * repeat between ** to last st k1  row 8 rs with larger needles k1 p1 k7
